title: 2018 Volkswagen Golf GTI Original Review | motoring.com.au

json.text:
Well here's some news that should pique the
interest of performance car enthusiasts: Volkswagen

has launched a new iteration of its GTI hot
hatch, and it's virtually the cheapest one
on sale in Australia in 15 years.

It has three doors and is called the Golf
GTI Original.
Let's go for a drive!

The Golf GTI Original lands in showrooms this
month priced from $37,490 plus on-road costs
- the cheapest a new GTI has been since 2004!

Conceptually, the 'Original' is a pared back
version of the Golf GTI performance hatch,

however when you look at the nitty gritty,
it misses out on very little.

There's a familiar 169kW tune of the GTI's
four-cylinder engine, new safety and tech,
and some cool embelishments inside.

So in effect you're missing out on navigation,
a sensor key and cornering lamps.
Nothing earth shattering if I'm honest.

Better than that ,there's hardly a cost-cutting
vibe to the cabin fitout.

You've got this gorgeous eight inch display,
crisp dials and switchgear, and really, many

of the same practical traits as the five-door
model.

Under the bonnet resides a 2.0-litre turbo
four that cranks out 169kW and 350Nm, sending
drive to the front wheels.

And enthusiasts can rejoice in the fact it
is offered standard with six-speed manual
transmission.
The equivalent DSG adds $2500.

On the road, the GTI really matches that ethos
with pure, back to basics dynamics.

Yes you miss out on adaptive suspension, but
in isolation, is that a problem?

Not at all, the basic setting is a nice balance
between comfort and sportiness.

In terms of the former, it's smooth and backroads
and isolates you from all but the harshest
of bumps..

And the trade-off in 
the cornersâ€¦ well worth it.

A 25kg weight shed over the five-door only
enhances the GTI's cornering finesse.

And power-down from a front drive hatch is
surprisingly strong.

The equivalent automatic is prone to more
hesitation upon taking off, and doesn't always
get things right.

Elsewhere, the GTI offers the same practical
traits as any other GTI model, room for four

adults in relative comfort and a refined European
vibe on and off the road.

In short, the GTI Original is upholds all
the important pillars of the GTI family.

Fun, practical and affordable - the simple
but proven recipe lives on.
